law.text: The State Treasurer shall consider any claim or defense permitted to be filed before the department and hear evidence concerning it. If the claimant establishes his claim, the State Treasurer shall, when the time for appeal or further legal procedure has expired, authorize payment to him of a sum equal to the amount paid into the State Treasury in compliance with this chapter. The decision shall be in writing and shall state the substance of the evidence heard by the State Treasurer, if a transcript is not kept. The decision shall be a matter of public record.
law.history: Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 58, sec. 12, effective March 10, 1994; ch. 83, sec. 9, effective July 15, 1994; and ch. 276, sec. 11, effective July 15, 1994. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1615.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/15/94). This section was amended by 1994 Ky. Acts chs. 58, 83, and 276. Where these Acts are not in conflict, they have been codified together. Where a conflict exists between chs. 83 and 276, Acts ch. 276, which was last enacted by the General Assembly, prevails under KRS 446.250.
